intro: Pteropsis tricuspidata, commonly known as the three-pointed pteropsis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves with three pointed lobes. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom during the spring and early summer. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Due to habitat loss, Pteropsis tricuspidata is considered vulnerable and is protected in several conservation programs.
